Jeremy,
 
Juli is right, it is very helpfull to have your questions though=
t out before a session especially if the session is pertaining to a certain=
 topic.
 
If you wing it, like juli said you will tend to speed up and over=
lap the next question with the previous answer and then you think you did 
=
not recieve a response so you ask the same question again. I had this happe=
n a few day's ago and when I repeated the question my tech's
mike and lisa =
both said "AGAIN" they start to lose patience sometimes, but you have to re=
member to them we must be like dealing with kindergarten children.
 
Bruce
=
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ghostchasingfool@yahoo.c=
omDate: Thu, 31 Jan 2008 15:18:30 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New File
=





Jeremy:
               You may also want to try and ask the questions =
quickly (I often times write them down prior to a session).  The reason bei=
ng I have noticed that many people drag the questions or ask more than one =
question prior to getting a response.  Please note that in my research I ha=
ve on occasion spoken over them and get not the immediate response because =
I was too busy talking.  I have even gotten from my tec David to ("I'm  Tal=
king) which was funny cause anyone that knows me, knows I love to gab, lol.=
  I have attached to clips so you can see what I am talking about.  The fir=
st one David tells me that basicly I needed to listen and not speak, for he=
 was not done.  The second, Joel is asking a questions and the question see=
ms to go on and on, only to have David say "Joel Speak Up".
 
             =
     In addition, I have also gotten as many as 3 spirits responding to you=
r question at the same time.  I believe Bruce and Steve have experienced th=
at on more than one occasion.  Maybe they could post or attach one of these=
 files for an example.  
 
                  They know whats going on, and =
they will comply with you and guide you along the way.  Best of Luck and Gr=
eat Job!ecuyler <ecuyler@...> wrote:


Sorry Bruce. I was so excited,=
 I got carried away. When I'm excited,I have a totally different thought pa=
ttern. I do understand what you are saying though about doing it one questi=
onat a time. I'll be sure to do that from now on. Thanks for the help.Jerem=
y--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday<paranormalinvestigating@...=
> wrote:>> > Jeremy,> > There are quite a few answer or messages just in th=
is clip.> My suggestion is to go over the clip a question at a time.> > Put=
 the whole recording into your editer and go to the beginning> of a questio=
n and then save the question and the preceeding signalup to the next questi=
on.> In a file of it's own. Go over the recorded data following thesingle q=
uestion and look for specific answers.> to that question. If there are any =
save that answer to a new file inthe editer and slow it or clean it a bit s=
o it is compehencible.> then paste it back where it belongs in the question=
 file. You shouldnow have the question and answer in one file.> Save it and=
 label it with the question and answer as one file.> > I hope you understan=
d that explination, if not fire back somequestions and I'll try to clarify.=
> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: ecuyler@...: Thu, 31 Jan 2=
008 02:46:17+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: New File> > > > > After listening a=
gain, I think the "tells me to" part is morethanlikely just a radio station=
.Jeremy--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com,"ecuyler" <ecuyler@> wrote:>> Just po=
sted a new file on Esnips. It'sfairly big in size so I went> ahead and put =
it on there to help savespace on here. This is thelink:>http://www.esnips.c=
om/doc/99a4a4b1-de10-40d8-943e-85b809a2332a/Session-4-01_30_08-20-125-govt>=
> I did as Bruce had asked and just used the RS 20-125 with a digital>recor=
der and this is what I came up with. It's a little over 30>seconds long. > =
> Bruce, if you still want to hear all of thissession, I will put it> all o=
n Esnips. Just let me know. There isquite a bit more to it> than just this =
one clip. It's amazing all thethings that came through.> > Here's a little =
background on the file. Iasked two questions. The> first was, "Is the US go=
vernemnt using ITCresearch?" The second,> "How is the US goverment using IT=
C research?"I hear these things in> this order: "Yeah it is, just stop it, =
juststop, you need help," and> something toward the end that I can't quitem=
ake out. Sounds like a> couple of words and then "tells me to." Letme know =
what you think.> > Jeremy> > > > > > > > __________________________________=
